sentences.sContent: Over the last two years the president’s position has weakened.
sentences.sCn: 过去两年来，总统的地位被削弱了。

sentences.sContent: Changes in policy have weakened the power of the trade unions.
sentences.sCn: 政策的变化削弱了工会的力量。

sentences.sContent: The absence of this witness has weakened the case against the accused.
sentences.sCn: 这名证人的缺席削弱了对被告的指控力度。

words.tran: [经] 疲软的；虚弱的；无力的；不牢固的
虚弱地；无力地；软弱地；有病地

trans.tranOther: to make someone or something less powerful or less important, or to become less powerful
